DataElement.preferredName: Prior Blinatumomab Other CD19 Gene Direct Therapeutic Procedure Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to prior administration of blinatumomab or other CD19 direct therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Blinatumomab Other CD19 Gene Direct Therapeutic Procedure Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._This gene plays a role in signal transduction and regulates the response of B cells to antigens._As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Blinatumomab Other CD19 Gene Direct Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:This gene plays a role in signal transduction and regulates the response of B cells to antigens.:As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
This gene plays a role in signal transduction and regulates the response of B cells to antigens.
As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
